title: How to Add Fonts to Picsart on Mobile or Desktop

steps.title: Download the font to your device.
steps.content: Download the font to your device. Before you can add a custom font to Picsart, you must have the font file on your device. While some third-party apps offer font downloads, it's best to download the font to your computer instead. Once downloaded, transfer the file to your iPhone, iPad , or Android . You can connect your computer to your device to transfer it via cable, or you can use a cloud service such as iCloud or Google Drive to sync files.

steps.title: Locate the font file and export it.
steps.content: Locate the font file and export it. This will vary depending on your device. iPhone and iPad : Open the Files app. Tap the font file. Tap the Share icon. Tap Picsart in the list of apps. Android : Open your file viewer. Select the font file. Tap ⋮ . Tap Extract to… Tap Picsart .

steps.title: Open the Picsart app.
steps.content: Open the Picsart app. Picsart is available for Android and iOS.

steps.title: Open a project.
steps.content: Open a project. You can open a new or existing project.

steps.title: Tap Font.
steps.content: Tap Font . This is at the bottom of the editor. [1] X Research source If you don't see this option, tap Text to add text you can edit first. Then, tap the checkmark.

steps.title: Tap My Fonts.
steps.content: Tap My Fonts . This is at the bottom, underneath a heart icon.

steps.title: Tap your exported font.
steps.content: Tap your exported font. The font will be added to your library.

steps.title: Download the font to your computer.
steps.content: Download the font to your computer. Before you can add a custom font to Picsart, you must have the font file on your device. You can use websites such as DaFont , Fontspace , and Google Fonts . Once downloaded, make sure to unzip the fonts. They must be in .TTF format.

steps.title: Go to https://picsart.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://picsart.com/ in a web browser. If you aren't already logged in, click Log in to do so now.

steps.title: Open a project.
steps.content: Open a project. You can open a new or existing project.

steps.title: Click Uploads.
steps.content: Click Uploads . This is in the left panel.

steps.title: Select your font file.
steps.content: Select your font file. You can also drag-and-drop the file into the upload area. The font will be added to your library. You can find it in the Uploads section or Text section. [2] X Research source
